diff_analysis.evidence: In the old code, the NTS-KE server accepted incoming TCP connections in an unbounded loop without any concurrency limit or back-pressure. Each accepted connection spawned a new task, allowing an attacker to open arbitrarily many simultaneous connections and exhaust file descriptors, memory, or other resources. The patch introduces a configurable concurrent_connections limit enforced via a tokio::sync::Semaphore and adds handling for resource exhaustion errors, thereby mitigating uncontrolled resource allocation (CWE-770).
